event_desc_eng:
Our host is the Emmaus Church in the heart of Kreuzberg 36 on Lausitzer Platz. You can work in the church coffee shop or buy coffee, tea, or a piece of cake at a reasonable price. If you feel like it, you are also free to meditate in the church room. 

Churches are open spaces ‚Äì or at least they should be! For this reason we‚Äôre very grateful to Emmaus Church for opening their doors to the public for a day of coworking.

event_desc_eng: We want to kick off the Berlin Coworking Festival with two things we all enjoy: fun and food! Join us for a casual community breakfast at Ringbahn Coworking and get to know our space and our members. Stay after the breakfast to get some work done in our coworking space. We will be offering free coworking all week on a first-come-first-serve basis so be sure to arrive early! It‚Äôs a great chance to meet new people and work on independent projects within a community-focused atmosphere.

event_desc_eng:
Want to learn how to create an open-source project or how to contribute in existing project?
What are typical problems for new open-source projects?
How can you start building a community to help others?
Join our meeting at Ringbahn-Coworking space where we will be sharing our experiences. We will discuss several topics:
‚Ä¢  Prerequisites for starting an open-source project or a threshold.
‚Ä¢  How to start building a project community that will allow it to be used in the real world.
‚Ä¢  Defining the tipping point; what it takes for a project to become so widely used so that community can support itself.

NOTE: The format of our discussion will be more similar to a workshop than presentations, so feel free to bring your questions and ideas for brainstorming sessions.

event_desc_eng: Do you have a great new project but need objective feedback? Pitch Day is the perfect opportunity to test your ideas and get input from other professionals! event_desc_eng:
Are you a marketing maven? A strategic content creator? An insightful data analyst? Or just eager to improve your entrepreneurial skills? Join us for mini Skill Sharing Sessions at Ringbahn Coworking. You‚Äôre welcome as a participant, presenter, or both!
This collective knowledge sharing approach is the backbone of coworking and is one of the many benefits of working collectively, even on independent projects. This event will consist of various 15 minute skillshare sessions; 10 minute presentations followed by 5 minute discussion periods.

event_title_eng: Forms of communal living in Berlin
event_desc_eng:
Panel discussion on different forms of communal living. 

This discussion will take place as part of this year‚Äôs coworking festival Berlin, our aim is to broaden the discussion to include different ways of living as well as work; those who share their working space tend to be open to sharing their living space too.

Cohousing, coliving, podliving, cooperatives, tiny house communities ‚Äì these are all are forms of communal living that are getting more and more popular for people from various age groups, cultural, and social backgrounds.

During this discussion we will analyze the different types of communal living, the motives behind them, their main challenges, and their future prospects; all from people who are building the scene right now in Berlin.

If you are living communally, coliving and/ or coworking, using different sharing economy platforms, we would love to have your input. 

If you are curious about living communally in Berlin this is the right place to start as well. 

Panel speakers:

‚Ä¢  Tobias Brockmann; Co-founder of Happy Pigeons Coliving and Forever Day One
‚Ä¢  Naima Ritter; a Conscious Living Coach and sustainable development professional
‚Ä¢  A representative from a tiny house community ( TBC )
‚Ä¢  A representative from a Baugroup ( TBC )
‚Ä¢  A representative from a co-housing community (TBC)

Program 

6:00 PM: Doors open, informal networking 
6:30 PM: Panel discussion
8:00 PM: Open audience discussion
event_desc_de:
Podiumsdiskussion √ºber verschiedene gemeinschaftliche Wohnformen in Berlin. 

Im Rahmen des Coworking-Festivals werden wir das Thema ‚ÄûFormen des gemeinschaftlichen Lebens/ Wohnens‚Äú von verschiedenen Seiten n√§her betrachten. Folgende Wohnformen werden vorstellt:

‚Ä¢ Coliving 
‚Ä¢ Baugruppe
‚Ä¢ Pod-Living
‚Ä¢ Tiny-House community 

Dabei wird das Thema sowohl von der Nutzer & Projekt-Leiter, als auch von der wissenschaftlichen Seite beleuchtet werden. Motive, Herausforderungen und und Zukunftsperspektiven werden erl√§utert. 

Im Panel: 

Tobias Brockmann von "Happy Pigeons Coliving" & "Forever Day One" 

Naima Ritter von "Concious Coliving" 

Ein Vertreter der Tiny House Community (TBC)

Ein Vertreter einer Baugruppe (TBC)

Ein Co-housing‚Ä¢ Vertreter (TBC)

event_title_eng: Fashion: How to be a Conscious Consumer?
event_desc_eng:
What do you need to focus on as you are doing conscious consumerism?
To be conscious and sustainable when consuming‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs the new way to be! But what exactly does it mean to be conscious and how do you recognise fair clothes? 
From apple-leather to Pinatex, there is a lot to know and so many exciting new methods and ways to produce clothes that are not only good for you, but also for others and the planet. 

Once you start to inform yourself, sometimes all this information can turn into a infobesity, but! Don‚Äôt. Freak. Out! We've got you back! 

On September 11th, fineyellow is welcoming you to join their second workshop on 'How to be a Conscious Consumer?' and learn more about shifting toward a more conscious consumption model.

About the workshop holder:
Assunta Crux is the founder of fineyellow, a marketplace for fair and sustainable fashion. Before working on making sustainable fashion available to a broader target group, Assunta worked as a business developer building and scaling startups in different industries. She is a female entrepreneur and all about a lifestyle as sustainable as possible. Let her show you "hands-on" what sustainable fashion means! 

Visiting this workshop is your smooth and easy start into becoming a conscious consumer. Come as a beginner, leave as a pro!

‚ÄçThis event will take place at betahaus | Neuk√∂lln, Harzer Str. 39
event_title_de: Fashion: How to be a Conscious Consumer?

event_title_eng: Ask Ulrike! ‚Äì Everything you always wanted to know about a Soziallotsin ¬†
event_desc_eng:
(German-language event) 

An event in cooperation with In-Gesellsellschaft e.V., hosted by Renate M√ºller.
When and where? On September 12, 2019 5:00 pm at TUECHTIG, the first inclusive coworking space.

Ulrike Gehn (32 years):
‚ÄûLife is colourful like a rainbow, and inclusion is the rainbow‚Äôs colour.‚Äù
¬†
Ulrike was born in a small town on the river Elbe. The electric wheelchair is her trusted companion. She has been invested in the issue of inclusion ever since her days in school.
¬†
Following her office communications clerk apprenticeship and publishing a literature blog called ‚ÄúLeseleben‚Äù, Ulrike took up advanced training as an inclusion counselor at Kopf, Hand + Fuss in 2018.
¬†
Today, Ulrike is a certified inclusion counselor and first recipient of the Solidarisches Grundeinkommen, a pilot projekt of the state of Berlin, initiated by Berlin‚Äôs mayor Michael M√ºller in July 2019. She has worked as a Soziallotsin f√ºr Kopf, Hand + Fuss since August 2019.

On Thursday, September 12, Ulrike will talk about her experience as an inclusion counselor and Soziallotsin for Kopf, Hand + Fuss at TUECHTIG, the first inclusive workspace.
event_title_de: Frag Ulrike! ‚Äì Was du schon immer √ºber eine Soziallotsin wissen wolltest ¬†
event_desc_de:
(Event findet auf Deutsch statt)

Eine Veranstaltung in Kooperation mit In-Gesellsellschaft e.V., moderiert von Renate M√ºller.

Wann und wo? Am 12.09.2019 um 17:00 Uhr. Mit einer F√ºhrung durch den inklusiven Coworkingspace TUECHTIG.
¬†
Ulrike Gehn (32 Jahre):
‚ÄûDas Leben ist BUNT wie ein Regenbogen und Inklusion ist die Farbe des Regenbogens.‚Äú
Ulrike wurde in einem √ñrtchen an der Elbe geboren. Der E-Rollstuhl ist seit jeher ihr treuer Begleiter. Schon in der Schulzeit sammelte sie erste Erfahrungen mit Inklusion. 

Nach ihrer Ausbildung zur Kauffrau f√ºr B√ºrokommunikation und Betreiberin des ehemaligen Literaturblogs ‚Äôdas Leseleben' begann sie im September 2018 eine Weiterbildung zur Beraterin f√ºr Inklusion bei Kopf, Hand + Fuss.

Ulrike ist heute Inklusionsberaterin und die erste Empf√§ngerin des Solidarischen Grundeinkommens, eines Pilotprojekts des Landes Berlin. Dieses wurde vom Regierenden B√ºrgermeister Michael M√ºller im Juli 2019 ins Leben gerufen.

Als Soziallotsin verst√§rkt sie seit Anfang August 2019 das Team von Kopf, Hand + Fuss. 

Am Donnerstag, den 12. September, wird Ulrike von ihrer Arbeit als Inklusionsberaterin und Soziallotsin im inklusiven Coworking-Space TUECHTIG berichten.

event_title_eng: Ask Duygu and Gunnar: Everything you always wanted to know about Leichte Sprache
event_desc_eng:
(German-language event) 

An event in cooperation with In-Gesellsellschaft e.V., hosted by Renate M√ºller.
On September 10, 2019 11:00 am at TUECHTIG, the first inclusive coworking space.

Do you know the difference between Einfache Sprache, Leichte Sprache and Standardsprache?
Duygu √ñzen and Gunnar Friese will talk about their experiences with this topic. Gunnar is an expert on the language variety Leichte Sprache and Duygu checks the texts for intelligibility.
They will talk to Renate M√ºller (In-Gesellschaft e.V.) about related challenges and hurdles. Following this, the participants have the opportunity to translate a text into Leichte Sprache. And of course, the text will be proofread by Duygu.
event_title_de: Frag doch mal Duygu und Gunnar! ‚Äì Alles, was du schon immer √ºber Leichte Sprache wissen wolltest
event_desc_de:
(Event findet auf Deutsch statt)

Eine Veranstaltung in Kooperation mit In-Gesellschaft e.V., moderiert von Renate M√ºller.
¬†
Wann und Wo? Am 10.09.2019 um 11:00 Uhr, im ersten inklusiven Coworking-Space TUECHTIG, Berlin.

Wisst ihr, was die Unterschiede zwischen Einfacher Sprache, Leichter Sprache und Standardsprache sind?

Am 10.09.2019 um 11 Uhr kl√§ren euch Duygu √ñzen und Gunnar Friese dar√ºber auf. Gunnar ist Experte f√ºr die Sprachvariet√§t Leichte Sprache, und Duygu pr√ºft die Texte auf ihre Verst√§ndlichkeit.

Was dabei zu beachten ist und wo es H√ºrden gibt, davon berichten die beiden Experten im Interview mit Renate M√ºller vom Verein In-Gesellschaft.

Im Anschluss haben die Teilnehmer*Innen die M√∂glichkeit, einen regul√§ren Text in Leichte Sprache zu √ºbertragen. Nat√ºrlich wird der Text von Duygu gepr√ºft.

event_title_eng: Club Breakfast: The most motivating Monday in town!
event_desc_eng:
How do you like Mondays? Do you jump out of bed ready and excited for the week ‚Äì OR ‚Äì (like most of us) do you feel a bit nervous or anxious to get the week started?

Well, CoWomen and Life & Business Coach Chrissi are on a mission: We want you to fall in LOVE with Mondays! Because you‚Äôre so freaking excited to start a fresh new week and do the things you love. ‚ú®

Easier said than done? Not anymore! Come and join us at the #MotivationalMonday and together we‚Äôll kick off the week with a mix of motivation, actionable planning, share & support ‚Äì and of course a yummy, healthy breakfast!

Imagine yourself waking up with excitement (flawless!), because you can‚Äôt wait to start the week. You‚Äôll leave energized, with a clear action plan for the upcoming week, ready to kickass.

Join us and ‚Ä¶

‚Ä¢  Get motivated, be inspired, feel energized.
‚Ä¢  Create your weekly plan with a proven method, and see your productivity skyrocket.
‚Ä¢  Get rid of any struggle that might hold you back in our Share & Support Round.
‚Ä¢  Be elevated and celebrated for doing your best.
‚Ä¢  Enjoy a healthy breakfast in great company.

If you ever felt yourself struggling to get out of bed on Mondays, creating your weekly plan (even though you know you should), or feeling unmotivated ‚Äì this is for you! If you want, bring your own journal to keep track of your progresses and breakthroughs, the rest in on us. Breakfast starts at 8:30, please be on time üòâ

About Chrissi: Christine Muench is a Life & Business Coach and helps hundreds of women to find more purpose in their lives and careers. With her guiding principle ‚ÄúOwn your Life, Change the World‚Äù she‚Äôs building an international company that supports women in actively designing their lives. You can follow her on Instagram or Facebook @christineawsm where she shares actionable tips, insights, and motivation about creating a life you love.

The event is free for all CoWomen. Log in via the members area and register.

At CoWOmen we lunch together! And we will offer some lunch&learn-sessions every now and then.

So let‚Äôs do this together !

Join us on the sunny tables of Alte M√ºnze or in our beautiful headquarters ( ‚òî ) on Tuesdays and Wednesdays.

Bring your own lunch* and get ready to chat, network, relax, or simply eat in the company of other amazing women.

event_title_eng: KonMari‚Ñ¢ your life! Tidy up your life!
event_desc_eng:
Marie Kondo is known as the worlds most famous decluttering consultant. Her book ‚ÄúThe Life-Changing Magic of Tidying Up‚Äù has been published in more than 30 countries and became an international bestseller.

Business Psychologist Anika Schwertfeger is Berlin‚Äôs first officially certified KonMari‚Ñ¢ consultant. She has been coaching the method for almost two years and is now revealing her best decluttering tipps and hacks. Anika shares her personal and professional insights as an independent entrepreneur. You will learn about the connection between the physical und psychological power of tidying and its effects on body, mind and soul.

The event is free for all CoWomen members. Log in and sign up.

PS: Photos and videos are taken. If you don¬¥t want to be seen we will make sure that you are not visible.
event_title_de: KonMari‚Ñ¢ your life! Tidy up your life!
event_desc_de:

event_desc_eng:
We warmly invite you to our Show & Tell.
After 2 wonderful years of running Coconat we would very much like to give everyone a chance see what we have created here.

Join Co-Founder, Julianne Becker, in the lovely library for a presentation followed by a tour of the project. Either catch the last bus back to Berlin, stay for dinner, or even overnight!

During the presentation she will present information about the founding of Coconat and share some particular successes and difficulties of building up the project, which includes workation, coworking, and coliving, as well as our work in the region.

Participants will have plenty of time to ask specific questions, and have a chance to get to know each other as well, in true Coconat fashion.

By the end of it all, we hope everyone in the room feels they can call themselves a Coconaut!
event_desc_de:
(Veranstaltung findet auf Englisch statt)
Wir laden Euch herzlich zu unserem Show & Tell ein. Nach 2 wunderbaren Jahren mit Coconat m√∂chten wir pr√§sentieren, was wir hier geschaffen haben.

Trefft Mitbegr√ºnderin Julianne Becker in unserer wundersch√∂nen Bibliothek. Nach einer Pr√§sentation und einem Rundgang durch das Projekt nehmt entweder den letzten Bus zur√ºck nach Berlin, oder bleibt einfach zum Abendessen und sogar √ºber Nacht.

In ihrer Pr√§sentation wird Julianne Informationen √ºber die Gr√ºndung von Coconat pr√§sentieren und √ºber Erfolge und Schwierigkeiten beim Aufbau des Projekts berichten, und au√üerdem Coworking, "Workation" und Coliving sowie unser Engagement in der Region vorstellen.

Alle Teilnehmenden werden die Gelegenheit haben, eigene Fragen zu stellen und sich gegenseitig kennenzulernen ‚Äì typisch Coconat.

Am Ende von allem hoffen wir, dass jeder im Raum sich als echter Coconaut f√ºhlt!

event_title_eng: Free Coworking Day at Ahoy! Berlin
event_desc_eng: Open doors at Ahoy! Berlin on September 11th! You will have the chance to experience coworking in our main flex area and also in our biggest conference room.
event_title_de: Free Coworking Day bei Ahoy! Berlin am 11.09.

On Tuesday, 10 September, as part of the Berlin Coworking Festival, we‚Äôll be taking coworking to the park (weather-dependent)! Specifically, Heinrich-Lassen Park, conveniently located between our two spaces here: https://bit.ly/2MGlZwA

event_title_eng: First Floor Opening / Wine & Cheese Tasting
event_desc_eng:
